name: Bookbag Trivia Game | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text: Choose the clue that fits with hat, dogs, and berry. Connecting word clue: Turkey in the _______.
questions.explanation:
poll.

	The connecting word is straw. Straw hat, strawberry, "Straw Dogs" (the movie). A straw poll is one that's taken to get a general or preliminary idea about something.

questions.text: Which clue fits with market, dark, and red? Connecting word clue: Think butcher shop.
questions.explanation:
dead.

	Meat is the connecting word. Dark meat, red meat, dead meat, meat market. "You're dead meat" means "You'll be sorry!" A meat market could be a bar where people are looking to find sex partners.

questions.text: Find the clue that fits with counter, navy, and bag. Connecting word clue: Jack and the _______stalk.
questions.explanation:
soup.

	Bean is the connecting word. Bean counter, navy bean, beanbag, bean soup. A bean counter is a money manager or accountant.

questions.text: Which clue fits with hose, group, and system? Connecting word clue: Kind words, a cane, and a trellis all provide this.
questions.explanation:
child.

	Support is the connecting word. Support hose, support group, support system, child support. "Support system" is psycho-babble for friends and family members and other "supportive" folks. Support hose (or support stockings) are extra thick and tight to provide "support" for waitresses and other such people who are on their feet for long periods of time.

questions.text: Which clue fits with sex, book, and call? Connecting word clue: Alexander Graham Bell.
questions.explanation:
tag.

	Phone is the connecting word. Phone sex, phone book, phone call, phone tag. Other clues might be cell (phone) and (phone) bill.

questions.text: Find the clue that fits with plate, blank, and bag. Connecting word clue: It's only a _______ moon.
questions.explanation:
airplane.

	Paper is the connecting word. Paper plate, blank paper, paper bag, paper airplane. Other clues might be: (paper)back, (paper) tiger, waxed (paper), and (paper) trail.

questions.text: Find the clue that fits with hot, belly, and push. Connecting word clue: Items of clothing often have these.
questions.explanation:
mushroom.

	Button is the connecting word. Hot button, belly button, pushbutton, button mushroom. A button mushroom is a small one (I believe). A hot button issue is one that stirs people up.

questions.text: Find the clue that fits with catalog, credit, and board. Connecting word clue: Old-fashioned slang for "funny guy"--as in "What a _______ Danny is!"
questions.explanation:
library.

	Card is the connecting word. Card catalog, credit card, cardboard, library card. Libraries still issue library cards, but card catalogs are becoming extinct as they are replaced by computer databases.

questions.text: Which clue fits with book, worker, and suit? Connecting word clue: Take your sweater just in _______.
questions.explanation:
closed.

	Case is the connecting word. Bookcase, case worker, suitcase, case closed. A case worker is usually a social worker.

questions.text: Which clue fits with ice, skin, and soda? Connecting word clue: Rhymes with STREAM.
questions.explanation:
heavy.

	Cream is the connecting word. Ice-cream, skin cream, cream soda, and heavy cream. Heavy cream is pure cream (which you can whip in order to make whipped cream). Cream soda is vanilla-flavored soda pop.
